meanings.sent1: The clay was unformed and soft, waiting to be molded into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The artist stared at the unformed lump of clay, envisioning the masterpiece it could become.
meanings.sent3: The unformed dough resembled a shapeless blob, much to the amusement of the baker.
meanings.sent4: Her unformed ideas slowly took shape, like shadows forming in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The unformed clouds in the sky seemed to shift and change with each passing moment.

meanings.definition: Lacking definite or distinct shape or form
meanings.sent1: The fog was unformed, swirling and shapeless in the early morning mist.
meanings.sent2: The unformed shadows danced on the wall, casting eerie shapes in the dim room.
meanings.sent3: The unformed jello wobbled on the plate, much to the amusement of the children.
meanings.sent4: His unformed thoughts drifted aimlessly, like leaves in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The unformed mass of tangled wires made it difficult to distinguish one from the other.

meanings.sent1: The unformed plan lacked details and needed more work before it could be executed.
meanings.sent2: Her unformed talent showed promise but required nurturing to reach its full potential.
meanings.sent3: The unformed fruit was sour and unripe, causing a funny expression on his face.
meanings.sent4: His unformed skills were like seeds waiting to sprout and grow into something great.
meanings.sent5: The unformed relationship between them needed time and care to blossom into something beautiful.
